thread.title: Dad Rock grooves to one-hit wonders of '70s
thread.title_full: Dad Rock grooves to one-hit wonders of '70s

title: Dad Rock grooves to one-hit wonders of '70s
text:
'Ultimate Dad Rock' fake record album cover (Photo: Jeff Dionise, USA TODAY)
3 CONNECT 1 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE While some musicians produce a rock canon over a long and storied career, others contribute just three minutes of perfect pop to the world, never to be heard from again. And we love them for that.
On this week's episode of USA TODAY's Dad Rock podcast, hosts Patrick Foster and Jim Lenahan look back fondly on the one-hit wonders of the '70s. (Other decades will be featured in upcoming episodes.)
"I'm a classicist when it comes to one-hit wonders," Foster says. "I'm kind of pure about it. I want to make sure that the artist had no other hits at all. ... And also, I want to make sure that the song has a connection beyond just being a hit at that time, and what I mean by that is I think that a lot of these one-hit wonders appear in other places â€” they might be used in movies; they might be used as pop references."
So put on those big stereo headphones, pour a glass of cold duck, get comfortable on the shag carpet and press play.
All episodes of Dad Rock are available on:
